newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkey's coalition allies meet in political crisis.
newsitem.headline: Turkey's coalition allies meet in political crisis.

text.p: Turkish Prime Minister Necmettin Erbakan went into an unannounced meeting with his coalition partner Tansu Ciller on Wednesday amid a deepening political crisis, Anatolian news agency said
The state-run agency said the pair began talks in Erbakan's official residence. Ciller, the deputy prime minister, had earlier suggested elections as a solution to the dispute over Islamist activism.
The coalition has been slowly unravelling since the army began pushing Erbakan to crack down on Islamist activism in February.
Ciller is expected to threaten Erbakan in the coming days with pulling out of the coalition if he does not hand over power to her soon to take the country to early elections.
Polls are due by 2000 under normal circumstances.

Army criticism has forced the resignation of three True Path ministers and a handful of MPs in the last month. Three of the resignees joined the main opposition Motherland Party in a ceremony on Wednesday.
